extendedIngredients.name: ramen noodles
extendedIngredients.original: 2 (3 oz) packages beef flavored ramen noodles

title: Quick Asian Beef Noodle Soup
summary: Need a dairy free main course? Quick Asian Beef Noodle Soup could be a spectacular recipe to try. For $2.23 per serving, this recipe covers 38% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 406 calories, 33g of protein, and 15g of fat. This recipe serves 4. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 30 minutes. This recipe is liked by 3 foodies and cooks. It is perfect for Autumn. If you have bok choy, onion, beef ramen noodles, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the ground ginger you could follow this main course with the Ginger Cake with Crystallized Ginger Frosting as a dessert. Taking all factors into account, this recipe earns a spoonacular score of 85%, which is excellent. Similar recipes include Quick Asian Beef Noodle Soup, Quick Asian Beef, Vegetable & Noodle Soup, and [] Asian Beef & Noodle Soup with 5-Ingredients Beef Broth.

winePairing.pairingText: Gewurztraminer, Chenin Blanc, and Riesling are great choices for Asian. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. The Cave de Ribeauville Collection Gewurztraminer with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 19 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Cave de Ribeauville Collection Gewurztraminer
productMatches.description: This lemon yellow wine has an intensely aromatic bouquet, with notes of spice and lychee. On the palate, the mature acidity keeps the wine fresh, yet finessed. Pair with spicy food, soft cheeses, and pastries.Gewurztraminer is the most aromatic of Alsace wines. With its aromas of rose, lychee and spices, it embellishes our palate. Soft, it goes well with foie gras, a fruit-based dessert. Semi-dry, it accompanies spicy dishes or strong cheeses.

instructions: Brown meat in a large skillet. Drain off fat, and rinse meat using a colander.                        Transfer meat to a large cooking pot.  Stir in onion, garlic, and ginger.  Add water, and bring soup to a boil.  Stir in bok choy.  Reduce heat ,and simmer for about 3 minutes.                        Stir in noodles.  Simmer 3 minutes longer, or until bok choy and onions are crisp tender and noodles are soft.  Stir in seasoning packets, oil, and soy sauce.

steps.step: Brown meat in a large skillet.
Drain off fat, and rinse meat using a colander.
Transfer meat to a large cooking pot.  Stir in onion, garlic, and ginger.
Add water, and bring soup to a boil.  Stir in bok choy.  Reduce heat ,and simmer for about 3 minutes.
Stir in noodles.  Simmer 3 minutes longer, or until bok choy and onions are crisp tender and noodles are soft.  Stir in seasoning packets, oil, and soy sauce.
